comment.author: 89809226@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Nautical Art, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 46326198@N05
comment._content: I believe that Harry Davis on the right is my great grandfather Thomas Henry Davis, who was a telegraph engineer. Family legend says that he sailed on the Great Eastern when she was a cable-laying ship. In 1901 he was running a telegraphy school in Lewisham, living in what I presume was a large house with his wife, several children, mother-in-law, 3 servants and 6 student lodgers.

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
Hi uncleagent61

Thank you for helping us fill in the background to this picture. Knowing that Harry Davis may be Thomas Henry Davis, telegraph engineer, helps put this picture in much more context.

We would love to know any more information you have about your great grandfather.

Many thanks

Lucinda

comment.author: 25946936@N00
comment._content: "Father" is Henry Clifford, chief engineer of Telcon for many years (retired by the time of this photograph). Clifford was involved in all the early Atlantic Cable expeditions, from 1857 to 1866, designing the cable laying equipment. I have a page on him on my history of undersea telegraphy site: atlantic-cable.com/Article/Clifford/index.htm
